åœ¨é¢è¯•ä¸­ï¼ŒMySQL æ˜¯åç«¯å²—ä½æœ€å¸¸è€ƒçš„åŸºç¡€èƒ½åŠ›ä¹‹ä¸€ã€‚æœ¬æ–‡ä¸ä»…æ€»ç»“äº†å¸¸ç”¨ CRUD è¯­å¥ï¼Œè¿˜åŒ…å«å¸¸è§ç´¢å¼•ã€äº‹åŠ¡ã€é”æœºåˆ¶ç­‰æ ¸å¿ƒçŸ¥è¯†ç‚¹ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºé¢è¯•å¿«é€Ÿå¤ä¹ ã€‚

ğŸŸ¢ 1. åˆ›å»ºè¡¨ï¼ˆCREATE TABLEï¼‰

CREATE TABLE users ( id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT, name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, age INT CHECK (age >= 0), email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE, status TINYINT DEFAULT 1, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP );

ğŸŸ¡ 2. æ’å…¥æ•°æ®ï¼ˆINSERTï¼‰

INSERT INTO users (name, age, email) VALUES (‘Alice’, 25, ‘alice@example.com’);

INSERT INTO users (name, age, email) VALUES (‘Bob’, 30, ‘bob@example.com’), (‘Charlie’, 28, ‘charlie@example.com’);

INSERT IGNORE INTO users (email) VALUES (‘alice@example.com’);

REPLACE INTO users(id, name, email) VALUES (1, ‘Tom’, ’tom@example.com’);

ğŸ”µ 3. æŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ®ï¼ˆSELECTï¼‰

SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 20;

SELECT status, COUNT(*) AS total FROM users GROUP BY status HAVING total > 1;

SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY created_at DESC;

SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 20 OFFSET 0;

SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > (SELECT AVG(age) FROM users);

ğŸŸ  4. æ›´æ–°æ•°æ®ï¼ˆUPDATEï¼‰

UPDATE users SET age = age + 1 WHERE id = 1;

UPDATE users SET age = 26, status = 0 WHERE email = ‘alice@example.com’;

ğŸ”´ 5. åˆ é™¤æ•°æ®ï¼ˆDELETEï¼‰

DELETE FROM users WHERE id = 3;

DELETE FROM users;

TRUNCATE TABLE users;

ğŸ§© 6. å¤–é”®ï¼ˆFOREIGN KEYï¼‰

CREATE TABLE orders ( id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT, user_id INT, amount DECIMAL(10,2), FOREIGN KEY(user_id) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE );

ğŸ§± 7. ç´¢å¼•ï¼ˆINDEXï¼‰

CREATE INDEX idx_age ON users(age);

– ç´¢å¼•é‡ç‚¹ï¼š – 1. æœ€å·¦å‰ç¼€åŸåˆ™ – 2. è¦†ç›–ç´¢å¼• – 3. å‰ç¼€æ¨¡ç³ŠæŸ¥è¯¢ç´¢å¼•å¤±æ•ˆï¼ˆLIKE ‘%abc’ï¼‰ – 4. å¯¹ç´¢å¼•å­—æ®µä½¿ç”¨å‡½æ•°ä¼šå¯¼è‡´ç´¢å¼•å¤±æ•ˆ

ğŸ” 8. äº‹åŠ¡ï¼ˆTransactionï¼‰

START TRANSACTION;

UPDATE users SET age = age + 1 WHERE id = 1; UPDATE accounts SET money = money - 100 WHERE user_id = 1;

COMMIT;

– å›æ»šç¤ºä¾‹ ROLLBACK;

– ACID – Aï¼šåŸå­æ€§ – Cï¼šä¸€è‡´æ€§ – Iï¼šéš”ç¦»æ€§ – Dï¼šæŒä¹…æ€§

ğŸ”’ 9. é”æœºåˆ¶ï¼ˆInnoDBï¼‰

– è¡Œé”ï¼ˆæ’ä»–é”ï¼‰ SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 1 FOR UPDATE;

– å…±äº«é”ï¼ˆè¯»é”ï¼‰ SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 1 LOCK IN SHARE MODE;

– é—´éš™é”ï¼ˆNext-Key Lockï¼‰é€šå¸¸å‡ºç°åœ¨èŒƒå›´æŸ¥è¯¢ä¸­ SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 20 FOR UPDATE;

ğŸ“„ 10. è§†å›¾ï¼ˆVIEWï¼‰

CREATE VIEW active_users AS SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE status = 1;

UPDATE active_users SET name = ‘NewName’ WHERE id = 1;

âš™ï¸ 11. å­˜å‚¨è¿‡ç¨‹ï¼ˆStored Procedureï¼‰

DELIMITER

$$ CREATE PROCEDURE GetUserCount() BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users; END$$

DELIMITER ;

CALL GetUserCount();
